decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the original decision for planning application ref: 221777FUL, dated 26.04.2023. For the avoidance of doubt, the permission will be taken to have lapsed on 26.04.2026.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: 24615_100 PROPOSED GRD PL; 24615_101 PROPOSED FIRST FLOOR PL; 24615_102 PROPOSED SECOND FLOOR PL;  24615_103 PROPOSED THIRD FLOOR PL; 24615_104 PROPOSED ROOF PLAN PL; 24615_105 PROPOSED FRONT ELEVATION PL; 24615_106 PROPOSED REAR ELEVATION PL; 24615_107 PROPOSED SIDE ELEVATION PL; 24615_110 PROPOSED SECTION ELEVATION A-A PL; 24615_111 PROPOSED SECTION ELEVATION B-B PL; 24615_112 PROPOSED SECTION ELEVATION C-C PL; 24615_113 PROPOSED SECTION ELEVATION D-D PL

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Details of materials shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details under application ref: 242760CND, dated 21.10.2024

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | A minimum of sixteen (16) secure cycle storage spaces shall be provided on site in accordance with the location identified within the drawings and documents listed under condition 2. The cycle storage area shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and Supplementary Planning Guidance (Housing) (2012). | Refuse and recycling storage, as indicated on hereby approved plan reference 319_04_110 Rev. H, shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy S8 of the London Plan (2021). | Details of the noise assessment, including requirements for sound insulation of the building envelope and mitigation measures shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 242841CND, dated 29.08.2024

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the units in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Details of the fresh air ventilation system shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 242842CND, dated 06.09.2024

Reason: To minimise exposure to existing poor air quality, and provide a suitable internal living environment for future occupiers, in accordance with policy SI 1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012); and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The individual and combined external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development site shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise and vibration, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and SPG10. | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise and vibration, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and SPG10. | Prior to commencement of the development (except for initial site clearance, demolition and ground works), details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation of at least 10dB above the Building Regulations value for residential use, as necessary, of the floor/ceiling/walls separating the commercial areas and mechanical installations from dwellings. Where noise emissions include characteristic features, the Noise Rating level shall not exceed NR20 Leq 5mins (octaves) inside habitable rooms. Details of mitigation measures shall include the installation method, materials of separating structures and the resulting sound insulation value and internal sound/rating level. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits of the Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise and vibration, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and SPG10. | Details of the enhanced sound insulation values shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 242844CND, dated 29.08.2024.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the units in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),

- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,  - public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by  noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policies 7A, 7B and 7.15 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies D6, D10, D14, SI1, T3 and T7 of the London Plan (2021), the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise density.
description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) to vary conditions 2 (Approved Drawings), and removal of condition 13 (Landscaping) planning permission ref: 221777FUL dated 26/04/2023 for: Construction of mansard roof extension to provide two flats at third floor level; change of use of first floor ancillary office and staff facilities to create one self-contained flat; first floor rear extension over ground floor retail unit, to provide additional two flats; reconfiguration and internal alterations to existing four residential units; facilitated by single storey rear extension; alterations to existing shopfront; formation of new residential side entrance and adjoining bay projection; first floor rear terrace with associated timber screening and further associated external alterations. Amendment seeks to replace approved drawings with amended /updated drawings and removal of condition 13 related to landscaping due to fire strategy requirements
